solution.text:
The opposite angles of a parallelogram are always equal.
Hence, two of the angles are \(50^o\).
Also, the sum of all the angles of a parallelogram add up to \(360^o\).
Let the angle to be found be \(x\), sum of all the angles are \(50 + 50 + 2x = 360\)
\(2x=260\)
\(x=130^o\)
Hence, the angles are 50, 50, 130, 130.

content.text: In a parallelogram ABCD, \( \angle A\) measures \(50^o\), what are the measures of all the angles?
